report_title: IBISWorld | Bacon Production in the US Jan 2024
executive_summary: Bacon producers will likely display a robust performance over the next several years. Current trends suggest that revenue will consistently expand over the five years to 2024 and continue to inch up until 2029. This promising trajectory is backed by a rich historical precedent of steady growth. Buyers have consistently shown a willingness to pay premium prices for bacon because of its unique taste and versatility, fostering a thriving industry that has proved resilient even during economic downturns.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Pork prices take a tumble as competition intensifies
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Bacon producers have also faced boosted competition from alternative sources of protein during the current five-year period.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Bacon producers' market share is expected to climb
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: These companies are large, vertically integrated operations that span nationwide and globally. There exists a substantial disparity between the largest bacon producers and the majority of smaller businesses that generally focus on specialized products within smaller markets.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Niche market products are key expansion elements for bacon producers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Bacon producers are expansively focusing on value-added and specialty products to maintain their profitability. Products like jalapeño bacon and other specialty-cured variants that cater to niche markets are allowing producers to charge higher prices.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Industry consolidation may come in response to volatility
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the next five years, larger bacon producers will likely target greater scale in their operations, in an attempt to reduce risks and shield themselves from lower prices. This will result in continued industry consolidation, with the number of establishments expected to inch up over the next five years.

industry_definition: The Bacon Production industry comprises establishments that primarily produce bacon from pork. This includes slaughtering, processing, curing and packaging operations.

opportunities: High Performance Drivers: Price of red meat

key_trends: Pork prices are descending because of heightened competition from alternative protein sources and swelling per capita meat consumption.
Bacon manufacturers are focusing on value-added and specialty products, like jalapeño bacon, to maintain profitability.
The industry will likely also consolidate over the next five years, with larger producers scaling up to mitigate risks and ensure profitability.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Wholesale vendors have transformed bacon into diverse product and flavor options to meet demands of a broader consumer base.
More food producers are incorporating bacon into a wider variety of products, including sweet treats, reflecting shift towards fatty, salty and meaty flavors.
Food service companies are revitalizing bacon offerings to cater to health-conscious customers and dietary restrictions with healthier variants.
Retailers are focusing on ready-to-cook, individually packaged bacon products and organic/uncured options to meet convenience and health trends.

products_and_services.product_description: The convenience of fully cooked bacon is driving its market growth, particularly in dual-income households.
Health-conscious and flexitarian consumers' preference for healthier alternatives is leading to swelling market demand for poultry and vegetarian bacon.
The foodservice sector strongly favors slab and sliced bacon because of their versatility and high demand in dishes like burgers, salads and breakfast menus.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Bacon products with innovative processing techniques
products_and_services.product_description: Advanced processing techniques like high-pressure processing (HPP) and vacuum packaging are preserving the taste and texture of bacon, aiding in ensuring customer satisfaction.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Bacon products with innovative marketing strategies
products_and_services.product_description: Bacon producers are leveraging innovative marketing strategies, such as interactive online campaigns and unique packaging, to enhance their brand visibility and engage with consumers more effectively.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Convenience driving fully cooked bacon demand
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Swelling demand for convenience and ready-to-eat food products has sparked substantial expansion in the fully cooked bacon segment.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Foodservice demand for slab and sliced bacon
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The foodservice sector strongly favors slab and sliced bacon because of their versatility and high demand in dishes like burgers, salads and breakfast menus.
Swelling awareness regarding health and fitness among consumers is leading to boosted demand for poultry and vegetarian bacon.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The US is a net exporter of bacon with a trade surplus of $13.0 million.

business_locations.location_description: Texas has the highest number of bacon production establishments in the US, with 269 establishments accounting for 7.8% of the total.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Competition among bacon producers is intense as consumer tastes and preference for quality as well as additive-free products strengthen.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Innovative curing techniques and flavor profiles
barriers_points.barrier_description: To stay competitive, bacon producers explore innovative curing techniques and flavor profiles.

Swelling demand for plant-based alternatives is spurring competition, with producers venturing into producing vegan bacon. The competitive landscape could substantially shift with the introduction of lab-grown, cruelty-free pork, posing a potential threat to traditional bacon producers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases are the most significant expenditure for bacon producers, accounting for over half of the average bacon producer's revenue. Materials required by bacon producers typically include carcasses and packaging materials. For larger and more vertically integrated producers, livestock purchases also form a significant portion of costs, including feeding, facility maintenance and other related costs.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Profit margins hold steady despite challenges
volatility_points.volatility_description: Despite the volatile prices of industry products, profit margins have remained relatively stable over the five years to 2024. These fluctuating prices have made it difficult for bacon producers to pass on noteworthy price hikes to the consumer, which has prevented profit expansion.

FAQs.question: What are the key financial benchmarks for the bacon production industry?
FAQs.answer: According to the report, some key financial benchmarks are: Profit margin of 5.1% (lower than sector average), Average wage of $52,765 (higher than sector average), Largest cost is Purchases at 67.1% of revenue. The profit margins have remained relatively stable over the past 5 years despite challenges like volatile prices and competition.

FAQs.question: What are the major cost components for bacon producers?
FAQs.answer: The major cost components are: 1) Purchases (67.1% of revenue) including carcasses, packaging, and livestock for integrated producers. 2) Wages (12.3% of revenue) due to labor-intensive production processes. 3) Depreciation (2.2% of revenue). 4) Other costs (13.3% of revenue).

FAQs.question: What trends have impacted industry costs in recent years?
FAQs.answer: 1) Profit margins have remained stable despite volatile product prices and competition from substitutes like white meats, making it difficult to pass on price hikes. 2) Wages have increased due to the labor-intensive nature of bacon production. 3) Purchases, including carcasses, packaging and livestock, remain a substantial cost factor accounting for over 50% of revenue.

FAQs.question: What are some key financial ratios provided for the industry?
FAQs.answer: The report provides industry multiples like EBIT/Revenue, EBITDA/Revenue, Leverage ratio, as well as ratios for liquidity, coverage, leverage, operating performance, cash flow and debt service over 3-year, 5-year and 10-year periods. It also shows income statement, balance sheet and other detailed financial data.

FAQs.question: Are there any projections or estimates for future industry performance?
FAQs.answer: The report includes projections up to 2030 for some key metrics like revenue per employee, revenue per enterprise, employees per establishment, average wage, wages as a percentage of revenue, and percentage of imports and exports relative to revenue and demand.
